wikitext.*:
'''Beowulf ''' can refer to:

==The original work==
*'''[[Beowulf (poem)|''Beowulf'' (poem)]]''', an 8th-century epic long poem in [[Old English]], which Tolkien much studied.

==Books by J.R.R. Tolkien==
*'''''[[Beowulf: The Monsters and the Critics]]''''', lecture delivered in [[1936]], booklet published in [[1937]].
**Reprinted in ''[[The Monsters and the Critics, and Other Essays]]'' (1983).

*'''''[[Beowulf and the Critics]]''''', edited by [[Michael D.C. Drout]], published in [[2002]].

*'''''[[Beowulf: A Translation and Commentary]]''''', edited by [[Christopher Tolkien]], published in [[2014]].

====Contributed by Tolkien====
*''[[Beowulf and the Finnsburg Fragment]]'', a 1940 edition includes ''[[Prefatory Remarks on Prose Translation of 'Beowulf']]'' by [[J.R.R. Tolkien]].

====In other languages====
*''[[Om Beowulfsagan]]'', ("On the Tale of Beowulf") a 1975 Swedish collection of essays by [[J.R.R. Tolkien]]. 

==Books by others==
*''[[Beowulf: An Introduction to the Study of the Poem]]'', a 1921 book by [[R.W. Chambers]].
*[[Beowulf (Crossley-Holland translation)|''Beowulf'' (Crossley-Holland translation)]], a 1968 translation of ''Beowulf'' by Kevin Crossley-Holland
*''[[Beowulf and the Dragon]]'', illustrated by [[Anke Eißmann]] and a Foreword by [[Tom Shippey]].
*''[[Beowulf: Translation and Commentary (Tom Shippey)|Beowulf: Translation and Commentary]]'', a 2023 translation of ''Beowulf'' by [[Tom Shippey]].

==Chapters==
*"[[Beowulf: The Monsters and the Critics]]", a chapter in ''[[The Monsters and the Critics and Other Essays]]''.
*"[[On Translating Beowulf]]", a chapter in ''[[The Monsters and the Critics and Other Essays]]''.

==Poems by Tolkien==
*''[[The Tale of Beewolf Son of Echgethew]]'', an unfinished alliterative translation of the original ''Beowulf'', partially published as #88 in the ''[[Collected Poems of J.R.R. Tolkien]].

*'''''[[The Lay of Beowulf]]''''', another poem by J.R.R. Tolkien.
